files.patch:
@@ -176,1 +176,1 @@ - {@systemProperty http.keepAlive.time.proxy}

+ {@systemProperty http.keepAlive.time.proxy}

@@ -178,7 +178,7 @@ - where the server (or proxy) has not specified a keepalive time. If the - property is set in this case, then idle connections will be closed after the - specified number of seconds. If the property is set, and the server does - specify a keepalive time in a "Keep-Alive" response header, then the time specified - by the server is used. If the property is not set and also the server - does not specify a keepalive time, then connections are kept alive for an - implementation defined time, assuming {@code http.keepAlive} is {@code true}.

+ where the server (or proxy) has not specified a keepalive time. If the + property is set in this case, then idle connections will be closed after the + specified number of seconds. If the property is set, and the server does + specify a keepalive time in a "Keep-Alive" response header, then the time specified + by the server is used. If the property is not set and also the server + does not specify a keepalive time, then connections are kept alive for an + implementation defined time, assuming {@code http.keepAlive} is {@code true}.
